sen.e: Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Naruhisa learned driving during his stay in France and went for a drive with Prince Naruhiko, saying 'I want Prince Naruhiko to check my driving skill,' however, as his driving skill was untrustworthy, Prince Naruhiko said to him that 'As you are premature to drive, you would better refrain from it.

sen.e: However, Prince Naruhisa refused to be persuaded, and on April 1, 1923, he invited Prince Naruhiko to go for a drive saying that 'Shall we go for a drive to the summer resort Deauville on the Normandy coast a day or so?'

sen.j: そこで成久王はドライブの相手を同じく留学中の朝香宮鳩彦王に変え、同日朝に妃の成久王妃房子内親王やフランス人の運転手等と共にドライブに出発した。
sen.e: Then, Prince Naruhisa, changing partners, invited Prince Asakanomiya Yasuhiko who was also in France for study and started to go for a drive with Princess Fusako, the wife of Prince Naruhisa, a French driver and others in the morning on the same day.

sen.j: 途中で鳩彦王を拾いエヴルーで昼食をとったあと、成久王がハンドルを握った。
sen.e: On his way, he picked up Prince Yasuhiko and had lunch at Évreux, and then Prince Naruhisa came behind the wheel.

sen.j: ペリエ・ラ・カンパーニュの村から遠くない地点で前の車を追い抜こうとした際に、スピードの出し過ぎで車は大きく横に滑って道路を飛び出し、路傍のアカシアの大木に衝突した。
sen.e: At a place not far from the village of Perrier la Campagne, when he tried to pass a car in front, his car skidded violently sideways by over speeding, jumped out of the road and hit a big acacia tree by the roadside.

sen.e: At a place not far from the village of Perrier la Campagne, he lost control of the vehicle while trying to pass the car in front, skidding sideways before flying off the road and colliding with a large acacia tree at the roadside.

sen.j: この事故で成久王とフランス人運転手は即死、房子内親王と鳩彦王は重傷を負った。
sen.e: In that accident, Prince Naruhisa and the French driver were killed instantly and Princess Fusako and Prince Yasuhiko were seriously injured.

sen.e: Prince Naruhiko was informed by a news agency of that accident in his hotel in London and on the following day came back to France, where he saw the corpse of Prince Naruhisa on the spot.

sen.j: フィリップ・ペタン元帥やクレマンソーと会見した時に、両人より「アメリカが日本を撃つ用意をしている」との忠言を受け、帰国後、各方面に日米戦争不可避論を説いて回ったが、西園寺公望以外は誰も耳を傾ける者はいなかった。
sen.e: When he met with Marshal Philippe Pétain and Clemenceau, both of them said to him that 'The United States is preparing for attacking Japan,' which he went around in all quarters, upon his return to Japan, explaining by his opinion of inevitable war between Japan and the United States, however, nobody except Kinmochi SAIONJI gave careful attention to it.

sen.e: On the eve of the outbreak of war between Japan and the United States, he informed Hideki TOJO, War Minister about the Clemenceau's advice, however, Tojo refused to be persuaded saying that 'We cannot help fighting rather than becoming a ruined country doing nothing.'
